meanings.sent1: The tree had many snags sticking out from its trunk.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the snags on the old fence.
meanings.sent3: The snag on the sweater made it look like a porcupine.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit me like sharp snags in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The snag on the rock tore my shirt as I passed by.

meanings.sent1: Overcoming the snag in the project took time and effort.
meanings.sent2: Financial snags can delay the construction process.
meanings.sent3: The snag in the plan turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The snag in their relationship was finally resolved through communication.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with that snag felt like climbing a steep mountain.

meanings.sent1: She managed to snag the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent2: I tried to snag a good deal during the sale.
meanings.sent3: He snagged the opportunity before anyone else could.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman snagged a big fish in the river.
meanings.sent5: I hope to snag a seat in the front row at the concert.

meanings.sent1: Her hair snagged on the branch as she walked through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The kite snagged on the tree branch and wouldn't come down.
meanings.sent3: His shoelace snagged on the chair, causing him to trip.
meanings.sent4: The fabric snagged on the nail, tearing a hole in the curtain.
meanings.sent5: The thread snagged on a rough edge, causing the seamstress frustration.
